intro: Trichotolinum deserticola, commonly known as the desert hairgrass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its fine, hair-like leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It has a deep root system that enables it to access groundwater, making it highly drought-tolerant. Trichotolinum deserticola plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
